snippet: The company surprised Wall Street with an unexpected operating profit.
abstract: Electric carmaker Tesla Motors reports second-quarter loss of $30.5 million, or 26 cents a share, up from loss of $105.6 million, or $1 a share, one year earlier; revenue rose to $405.1 million from $26.6 million year ago; better-than-expected results push shares up more than 13 percent in after-hours trading.
lead_paragraph: The company surprised Wall Street with an unexpected operating profit.

headline.main: Topping Estimates, Tesla Narrows Quarterly Loss
headline.print_headline: Topping Estimates, Tesla Narrows Quarterly Loss
